The host is friendly and responsive. The place is so worth it as the views are nice considering the room has a balcony. I an very picky when it comes to booking rooms so I can definitely say this one is worth it.

Everything was perfect except you need to take 100 steps down and up to go on Main Street. You canâ€™t go to location directly by car motorcycle as well. The only thing which i found not well otherwise everything was exceptional.

Very sweet host. We arrived in Sapa very early at 5:30am. Got to the hotel at around 7-8am. We ordered breakfast and were really tired, i was almost falling asleep on the table. Dieu let me downstairs to sleep on a little couch!
Room was clean, accurate to photos. Its walkable to nearby restaurants and shops. We walked everywhere from the hotel.
The tour offered for valley trekking was splendid. Guide spoke great english and answered all questions.
Thereâ€™s also a sweet cat to greet you named Chicken.

The room is great with hot and cold shower, very nice airconditioning and brilliant view of the valley. The staffs are very helpful, accomodating and informative. highly recommended place to stay in sapa

Dieu Tran was super helpful, informative and enthusiastic during our stay. He assisted with finding a restaurant, booking a day trip in the rice fields and getting transport. The room was as described, clean and well located.
Great place to stay at, Dieu was very prompt to reply all of our enquiries and made sure we had everything we needed. Awesome hospitality and even greater host! Wouldnâ€™t do Sapa any other way !
Perfect, we really enjoyed our stay. Very central location but still quiet. The host is really helpful and friendly and the breakfast is also really good. And the views are stunning!

Great place to stay in Sa Pa. We arrived late for check (2am), but Dieu provided clear instructions so we could easily get in.
The place was large enough, they can make breakfast and have laundry services as well. Location is also great.
The bathroom was clean, but not spotless (like many other places weâ€™ve in vietnam). The bed could be more comfortable as well, very firm.
Overall Good value for the price.

We felt right at home when we came in and met Dieu!
He's really funny and friendly! He's a breath of fresh air from other hotels where it's hard to build a connection with the host!
He's also super honest on best activities on recommendations even if this means less business for him!
Loved our stay there! 10/10

such a gorgeous home with such a wonderful host. Lo was so helpful and always replied to any request we had super quickly. the location was so gorgeous and the room had the perfect view. only thing was it was slightly difficult for taxis to reach since itâ€™s not in Sapa main town but we still loved our stay nevertheless.

Het verblijf van mister Lo is precies zoals het op de fotoâ€™s staat, echt een fantastische plek! Midden tussen de rijstvelden, prachtig uitzicht en veel privacy. Persoonlijk vond ik het in het echt nog mooier dan op de fotoâ€™s ğŸ¤©
Mister Lo is heel vriendelijk en voorkomend. Kortom, een echte aanrader deze plek!

Loved our stay at Loâ€™s we booked very last minute and Lo was very accomodating with this! The bungalow has the most amazing sunrise view over the mountains and rice patties. Room was clean, and bathroom was good. No aircon but fan was provided!
Great accommodation in stunning location at a reasonable price with flexible check in. 30 minute taxi in to main town if needs be. Overall, excellent place and host super friendly and attentive

Quite far from the city centre, and getting in and out of city is difficult and expensive from this location. However, if you want to take some time out from daily life, rewind and recharge, it's the perfect place. It's secluded from the main population. The host and his wife were really nice.
Lo was very helpful with checking in and helped us to get a taxi to get to our bus stop in the early morning on the day we checked out. The room was amazing and we loved our stay!

A peaceful spot with authentic charm â€“ nothing fancy, but just right for a laid-back stay. Clean room, large comfy bed. Within walking distance of some nice restaurants and cafÃ©s. Lo is super friendly, helpful, and very responsive. He invited us to stay with his family for dinner. The view over the rice fields is beautiful, and it's very quiet at night. There is a heated mattress since it can get quite cold at night in February.

Place itself was beautiful - exactly like the pictures and the bathroom was very clean. No hand soap but did provide sachets of body wash and shampoo which was helpful since we arrived without our luggage.
Stored our luggage when it arrived and for a few hours on our final day, very responsive when we arrived with flexible check in (we arrived at 3 instead of our estimated 4-5pm).
It was noisier than expected since there were a group of rowdy boys in the home stay next door which we werenâ€™t expecting. Whilst the bungalow was private there were buildings above and not far below and you could see some people in the rice fields. Thought it would be more secluded.
Generally would recommend since it was out of sapa town and gave us a chance to try local food and see another village in the surrounding area.
Lo and his family were all lovely and very welcoming.

Staying at Lo's place was really awesome.
You take a taxi from Sa Pa to the listing. Depending on the vehicle, it can get you pretty close, only then you'd understand that the price of the taxi is worth it. The views were stunning, I kid you not.
We came during planting season, so instead of the green rice field in the picture, it was full of water. This was so nice especially during the full moon. The reflection of the moon as you sit outside was enchanting. The room is simple, it's a clean comfy bed and a hot shower (and a nice sink). Two sides of the room was all glass, so you could chill on the bed and be mesmerized by the view of the mountains in front or the rice field/pond on the side, it was amazing. Really worth the money on this one. Hot shower did not come on at first but Lo responded immediately (not even 10mins) and reset the hot shower and it worked like a charm. Lo was very helpful and the people of Ta Van are nothing but lovely. We really enjoyed our experience
We really enjoyed our stay! Everyone was very friendly and super helpful with everything. Also, great location and beautiful surroundings. Thank you so much :)

Super logement. Isole et au calme, câ€™est trÃ¨s agrÃ©able.

Lo's home is a beautiful space in Sa Pa, around 30 mins by Grab from the centre. clean and comfortable sleep. Thank you Lo!
Lovely place with stunning views all around. Highly recommend

nice peaceful stay in the roomy villa. The outlook is great and host very helpful.
Short steep 5 minute hike to some great little restos, really enjoyed this stay.
Very friendly host, beautiful and peaceful location. The room was amazing and had great views. There was a heated bed and it was a very nice stay.
Great stay! Clean, cozy, and well-located. Friendly host. Highly recommend!

one of the best places Iâ€™ve been to! definitely would not want to miss out.

Conveniently located, close to city centre.  Le was very friendly and provided all the assistance regarding facilities required in the room and also to plan sight seeing and transfer. Room was in good condition and had all the amenities promised. Good room heater and heated mattress. Overall, a lovely room experience of 2 day stay in Sapa. Value for money.

My best friend and I stayed at Leâ€™s place for 4 nights. Accommodations were decent, not plush; but precisely as advertised. Our first night the shower head became detached from its base. Thanks to good communication with the caretaker and staff, it was fixed the following day. The inclined slope up to the quarters (about 70 meters/75 yards) had some algae covering which could have been treacherous when wet. The staff worked on scraping it and sprinkling what appeared to be salt; although care was still necessary to avoid a fall or slip.
The room was small. While totally adequate for 1 person, it was a bit tight for 2 for more than a few days. Shelving was limited; closet space nonexistent, so gear had to be arranged on the floor. A short distance away were several superb restaurants, 2 of which provided us with delicious meals.
While accommodations were adequate (comfortable, clean and conveniently located), if I were to visit Sapa again, I would look into renting another place.
had an amazing stay, room was spacious and there was very little disturbance! thankful for the peace and quiet :)
The place is lovely and close to city centre. The host helped in making arrangements to travel. Would recommend anyone visiting sapa.

Place was clean and tidy and beds very comfortable. We even had electrical blanket that was very useful during cold nights.
The host is very very helpful. She speak very good English and helped us arrange a scooter. They also have a laundry service. On our last day she also printed our bus tickets so if I could give more stars I definitely would because we received really a lot of help.
Internet is very good and fast so if you need to work online that is a good place for you.

I canâ€™t say a bad thing about this place. Great location close enough to the center to walk but far enough away to be quiet. Clean, peaceful and easy to find. The host was also amazing with any inquiries we had.  Will definitely stay again!

A beautiful stay to remember - spacious villa suited a family with 2 teenagers and the views are to die for! Using Grab car booking cost less than US$3 each way and it was so peaceful staying just outside town so those amazing views could be enjoyed.
Cao was helpful and quick to respond and the laundry service was a life saver!
Very happy with our stay.

clean and cozy place with nice views of mountain. Host was warm and helpful with luggage too.

villa was super super amazing! all the rooms were  clean and looked exactly like described, the villa was super comfortable too :)

Myself and 3 friends were recommended to visit Sang and her families house and trekking. Sang collected us from our bus which got in at 2am and helped us settle in. The meals were delicious and the house is so beautiful. We spent a day relaxing by the pool and another day trekking. It rained a lot the day we were trekking so Sang and her husband bought us rain boots and ponchos. We could not recommend her enough, they are so good!!! I wish we could stay longer!
chá»‹ chá»§ ráº¥t lÃ  nice. 100% come back

Awesome place with a more awesome view. Staff were very nice and helpful. Only caveat is the location. Itâ€™s easy enough to find a driver to get to the place but getting somewhere from the place itself was a little challenging. Thankfully, the staff will assist you in calling for a taxi. Only regret for booking this stay is that I didnâ€™t book for longer!

The cabin itself was nice, nothing to shout about but the surroundings were super tranquil. Loved the greeneries lining the pathways, with panoramic views overlooking the paddy fields. There were some stairs leading up to the cabin, where you get a nice balcony and a large garden surrounding it. At night it looks magical all lit up. Beware of insects though. I enjoyed chilling in the room with Netflix and walking around the area especially when the air is clear (no fog).
I took the recommended taxi and as expected the ride was rough (took about 20-30 min from Sapa town). For meals, they didnâ€™t have halal options but I brought my own food & snacks and ordered white rice and omelette from their kitchen. They were kind enough to accommodate my requests. Breakfast was toasts with eggs and pancake (asian style) with syrup.
Worth staying for a relaxing time, otherwise not much to do. Pool wasnâ€™t clean enough to swim in.

If you are ready to relax and be away from the chaos of Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh, this is the place for you.  Sapa town is only about a 15 minute taxi or grab away. This is by far worth it simply for the view and the surroundings of the ecology. The staff is incredible as well. They were so attentive and friendly.  Breakfast was included and it was excellent! We will be returning here the next time we are in Vietnam.

We had a wonderful, peaceful stay at Khanhâ€™s eco lodge in SaPa. The view from the bungalow and from the lodgeâ€™s gardens and pool is breathtaking. The staff were so friendly and bent over backwards to make our stay memorable. Great to be in a small family lodge with only a few bungalows  compared to the large resorts surrounding SaPa. The rooms are relatively basic but are very comfy and are built and decorated beautifully in the traditional styles. Location is peaceful away from the main town but we never had a problem getting a Grab the 10-15 mins into town. It was lovely watching the rice farmers at work and falling asleep to the sound of nature.

Amazing service, clean and eco friendly. The view from this bungalow was incredible!!! Overlooking the rice paddies and mountain range, you can wake up in the morning and see the farmers planting their vegetables and rice: truly a tranquil experience.

This place will always have a special place in our hearts! We celebrated our honeymoon here and it was very memorable even though we didnâ€™t get to enjoy the sun, the views were still wonderful when the fog got clearer. At night it was lightly raining and very peaceful to fall asleep to. The staff were very professional and wonderful. The kitchen also cooked delicious meals and breakfast for us. We received the best massages here and ended up getting more than one. Everyone was very welcoming, even their small dog and cats who were so friendly and added to the experience.

This was the highlight of our stay in SaPa. The views from the room, poolside and restaurant are beautiful. The staff are very friendly and helpful. If you eat at the accommodation, the food is very fresh and they cook it for you whenever you would like as long as you give them notice.
The room was traditional and no AC but at the time of year we visited we found this ok. The staff came round and cleaned the bathroom and refreshed towels everyday.
We would highly recommend this accommodation if you would like to wake up to amazing views and stay out of the busyness of the main town but still be in a short distance to Grab in.

We had an excellent stay at this Airbnb. We stayed just for a night after climbing Mount fansipan but it was amazing. Everything was as described. Loved the food and the staff who were very attentive to our needs. I strongly recommend this listing for anyone looking for a stay far from city hustle.

What an amazing peaceful oasis. The grounds are beautiful and perfectly manicured. The staff are so wonderful and friendly. They organized laundry and a driver for everything we needed. The restaurant is incredible. Felt right at home and the views are incredible. This definitely felt like a honeymoon trip!!  Thanks for an amazing stay !

Eco Palms House is like a fantasy land. Khanh and the rest of the staff are super warm, welcoming and acommodating. They made sure that we felt right at home and we did. The view is just unmatched. The landscape and how everything was put together was just magical. I love our bungalow because of the privacy and the view. The breakfast was included and we thoroughly enjoyed eating it while looking at the majestic view. I highly recommend it!

This was a perfect place for us to relax while in Sa Pa! The pool is great, the water was warm and the views incredible. The food here is some of the best we've had on the trip so far. All of the drinks and coffees were top tier. Their massage and laundry services were wonderful on site. The staff are all very friendly and go over and beyond to ensure our stay was perfect. Wish we could stay longer!

The location, a private quiet place away from town, but close enough to get a short grab into town. It's so peaceful with the best views and the kitchen is unreal. The food was perfect with fresh ingredients from the farm. The staff were so friendly and helped us so much. They were so helpful with our daughter and loved playing with her. They let her feed their koi fish in their pond and play with their animals.
Being a little bit away from central Sa Pa there are motorcycles to hire 500m walk up the road.
If you arenâ€™t keen to ride, Khanh was ordering grab taxis for people.
We will definitely come back here or refer to our friends.
We highly recommend this location!
We zijn hartelijk ontvangen door de familie. De bungalow was erg mooi, met een fijn bad en een prachtig uitzicht. Helaas geen zon, maar we hebben heerlijk bij de open haard gezeten.

Magnifique endroit avec une vue Ã  couper le souffle. Les hÃ´tes ont Ã©tÃ© trÃ¨s accueillants et chaleureux de notre arrivÃ©e jusqu'au moment du dÃ©part. La nourriture du restaurant est excellente autant pour le petit dÃ©jeuner que les repas. Je recommande chaudement !

superhost. Super friendly, nice, helpful and welcoming. felt like home and family. Make any special requests and they will do it for you. The room is super cozy and clean. Most importantly the view and the vibe is very peaceful. Highly recommend dining in the restaurant, super authentic, delicious and fresh. Stayed there for three days and had every meal in their restaurant. Lovely place, memorable stay and experience. Hope to come back in the future.

Die gesamte Anlage ist wunderschÃ¶n in den Bergen gelegen und sehr schÃ¶n angelegt.

Had a great time here, unfortunately was only able to stay 1 night but the staff were very accommodating and helpful and room was amazing and well equipped for the winter season. Great experience!

A beautiful, eco-friendly retreat with exceptional service, this family-owned gem in Sapa offers a chef-style restaurant, stunning views, and a perfect location to escape and unwind.
The staff goes above and beyond to ensure a memorable stay.

Amazing natural beauty here in a traditional setting. Would recommend to anyone looking to experience the real Sa Pa, and great vegetarian options at the restaurant here. They were very accommodating of custom requests as we don't eat egg either.
Amazing few days, only regret is that we didnâ€™t stay longer! Breathtaking views from the bedroom, 10/10 food and the staff were so wonderful and friendly would recommend anyone!

The Eco Palms Lodge is a place that I would highly recommend to everyone traveling to Sapa. Their staff is amazing, especially Nam, along with the ladies in the kitchen and housekeeping. The front desk gentleman is also extremely personable and will provide his expert opinion to tour the area. The owners Khanh, and his wife are very hospitable, and this is a definite must-stay for Sapa and visiting Fanispan and other attractions, shops, and villages. I would not stay anywhere else upon my return to Sapa. This felt like family, and I was extremely welcomed and felt great about the experience. The restaurant serves delicious food, and they were very accommodating in preparing me breakfast for some of my early morning activities even before the kitchen officially opened. Five Star service, without a doubt!!! Please stay here for a visit, and you will not be disappointed.

This was by far the best Airbnb experience that we have ever had. The property is absolutely stunning and the views from the room are breathtaking. The food was the best we had in Vietnam and the complementary breakfast was so convenient. The staff consists of the nicest humans we have honestly ever met and they made us feel like we were at home. Their hospitality is something we have never experienced before. There are more than enough activities available including swimming in their pool, getting a massage on the property, taking a cooking class and trekking tours. The taxi from SaPa is 200k Vietnamese Dong and the staff will call it for you whenever you would like to leave the property. By the end of the trip we wanted to stay at the Eco Palms forever. This was genuinely the best experience weâ€™ve had and I couldnâ€™t recommend it more.
We absolutely loved our stay at Eco Palms. Wonderful staff and fantastic food and amenities. Very comfortable and unique bungalows with stunning views.
Enjoyed my stay and great staff who was attentive enough to all my needs. great view from my room as well.
We had a great stay!  Well run place with friendly helpful staff.

The stay was absolutely wonderful. From the view to the ambience of the place. Everything was clean just the toilet seat was broken a bit. Very spacious and cozy aesthetic. We also enjoyed some Netflix at night.

We arrive early and getvto check in early. I think we got upgraded from 2 queen bed room to large house with 4 queen bed. Full utilities and kitchen and beautiful bathroom with bathtub. The view was stunning. Love it. Beautiful valley scenery with paddy terrace and mountains. Recommended for quiet and peaceful place to rest.

Die beste Unterkunft in ganz Vietnam. Stellt euch einfach vor ihr seid mitten im Berg, habt ein blitzsauberes Zimmer mit traumhafter Aussicht (+ beheizte Decken) und werdet jeden Abend und Morgen fÃ¼r angemessene Preise sehr lecker bekocht. We truly loved our stay! Tucked away in the mountains, it was peaceful, quiet, and surrounded by natureâ€”waking up to the stunning view was such a treat. Even though we arrived at 2am, the on-site staff greeted us warmly and made check-in a breeze. A big heartfelt thank you to the lovely Sumyâ€”she went above and beyond to help us with everything from Fansipan tickets, local guide arrangements, to recommending massage spots. Her kindness and care made our trip extra special. The staff were always ready to help, even giving us a heads-up about bugs in the area, which is to be expected since we were in the mountains. The taxi service tied to the stay made getting to and from the town centre effortless throughout the trip. We also loved the free breakfast, delicious Vietnamese coffee, and the sweet dogs that kept us company each morning. It was such a memorable stayâ€”weâ€™re so grateful and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful mountain retreat.

A bit of a hassle to get there, the roads are not the best, but itâ€™s so worth it! Itâ€™s calm and peaceful and the view is unmatched. Breakfast is included and you can have dinner here as well (which is recommended as there are not many restaurants around). The host was very welcoming and helpful and they have super cute dogs and cats to cuddle with!

Highly recommend this place. Itâ€™s a very special experience immersed in the local community. Itâ€™s not walking distance to main sapa town but itâ€™s a short car ride to everything. The host was wonderful, generous and always ready to help. The food cooked in the Homestay was delicious and the walk around the local
Village was delightful. Overall it was an authentic experience. Private space, warm beds either heated blankets.

Theyâ€™re on top of the mountain which makes the place more private. Since we prefer to stay in a peaceful and relaxing place after we go around the tourist spots in Sapa. Youâ€™ll get to see the best like a panoramic view of mountains and an overlooking view of Sapa. The receptionist was so good and assisted us very well. Also, she cooks too! The room is so cozy that we donâ€™t want to leave this place. Overall our stay is perfect and unforgettable. Thank you so much!

TLDR; highly recommended if you need a retreat spot/ romantic getaway. Not the most ideal for solo travelers, or those that want good access to Sapa Town.
Initially booked for a three night stay - but cut it to one night since the roads and lights towards the place wasn't as developed to our liking - it was rocky, about 30-40 mins by car, and would be inconvenient for when we stayed out late in Sapa Town. HOWEVER, the host did try to alleviate the blow on the remote location by offering to book a car for us if Grabs were difficult to find. Maybe until the infrastructure is more solid, we'd be very happy for a return.
BUT - if you're keen to make this your retreat away from the noise, and don't have to go into Sapa Town that often, I would highly recommend this place. It has it's own pool, and despite the distance - WiFi, running water and heating were are superb. Not to mention a good selection of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner if you get hungry. Highly recommend the hotpot.

Beautiful home with lovely staff, little out of town but a short 20 minute taxi ride in. Filled with friendly pets and an amazing view with a cosy wooden style living room with a fire to keep you warm.

I really enjoyed staying here even in the bad weather, i felt like i was in my relatives home. The staffs were so nice, as soon as I sat on the sofa, they set up the fireplace immediately to keep me warm. The place is so cozy and tranquil. I definitely come back here again.

Der Aufenthalt war sehr schÃ¶n, die ganze Familie war super nett und hat sich sehr um uns gekÃ¼mmert. My partner and I stayed here for our anniversary and this place is by far the best place we have ever stayed.
the house was decorated extremely lovely and romantic as per requested.
the house decor is stunning and charming and the views are unmatched and glorious.
the workers are super friendly, attentive, warm, and welcoming.
we felt so at home and at peace. the view is just out of this world. better than going to another tourist attraction with a view.
we love it so much and it was the perfect location to stay on our anniversary.. it couldn't have been more perfect. thank you so much

Amazing stay with amazing view and friendly hosts! Will come back again for sure!
The place was magical and peaceful i wish i stayed longer , i would definitely recommend it

This was a cozy home stay in Sapa for myself and my 60-year old parents. The beds are really comfy, the bathroom was clean and the place felt like a cottage. It was lovely. We came right after the typhoon so they were still fixing the roads. It was a bit scary coming up the mountain in our arranged car ride recommended from the host (they also have Grab in Sapa for comparable prices), but we came so late and the drivers were very knowledgeable of the roads so we felt a bit safer. The owners were nice, they greeted us and checked us in at 12am! The ownerâ€™s dogs and cat were one of the best parts! They also serve free breakfast which was delicious. You have the occasional spider or insects, but it was perfectly fine. Overall, it was a fantastic stay in Sapa and really appreciate the hosts and their hard work!
Super super beautiful place. Surrounded by gorgeous nature and due to its location, everything felt ethereal and unreal. Scenery was truly amazing.
Good place to stay
Wonderful host
We loved our stay! The Food was amazing, we will stay here again :)

We stay for 1 days, we check in on time and got enough time just to chill/relax and appreciating the view. The host can speaked & understand english. They also served free breakfast, even though not stated in the amenities . There's also a few menu that Muslim can choose. We use taxi provide by the host and the driver was always on time and even arrived early.

Lo is such a great host. Highly recommended staying at his property. Such a beautiful property overlooking the paddy fields. Lo was extremely friendly and flexible according to our plan. Canâ€™t wait to come back here

Place is exactly same as in pic. I had to use hostâ€™s personal kitchen since no separate kitchen. Which was bit uncomfortable. No wardrobe to keep stuff. Everything had to be kept on floor. Whatever is shown in picture, is only available. Lo was helpful. He gave me ride to market on his way to work n brought me to property on his way back, was great. He allowed me to check in early, which was good experience.

The place is beautiful and Lo was very helpful. I will however mention that the curtains let in a lot of light in morning making it quite hard to sleep. Moreover, lots of people pass this room to see the view and the glass walls donâ€™t ensure much privacy. Lastly, if you are thinking of renting motorbike, be wary the roads are very rocky and difficult in one section .    Overall we loved the cabin though- very clean and beautiful views-  thank you Lo
Lo and his wife were great hosts , they helped us with food recommendations, even got us a motorbike straight to our place and they were just extremely helpful and a kind people .
Lo and his wife created a very welcoming home for us. The view was even more beautiful than I expected, and the room was absolutely perfect. I would recommend for anyone who wants to explore Sapa.

Place was just as described, with a beautiful view and a nice clean minimal room. The rice on the terrace was just being planted so it wasn't green yet, so the view would probably be nicer in a month other than May. The place was slightly hard to find and hard to get to (lots of walking up and down steep hills), but the upshot is that it's very peaceful, with no cars going by.

Our 3-day stay in Loâ€™s place was amazing! The room was super cozy, plus they have a  spacious comfort room. My favorite is their bed heater, perfect for the cold weather when we visited. Lo was very helpful also, would definitely recommend!

Had a great visit, place is inside Ta Van village which had quiet and local vibe. There are a lot of good places to have a drink and just explore the village itself. The house was little bit hard to find due to incorrect Google Maps location/route but host was really helpful and we made it! Next night we stayed at another place of the same host which was perfect ğŸ™

Staying at Loâ€™s place was a highlight of our trip. The small house is simple but cozy, with a bed, a private bathroom, and an absolutely stunning view over the rice terraces. Itâ€™s the perfect spot to relax, go hiking, and take in the natural beauty of the Sapa.
The road to get there is a bit tricky and steep, but totally worth it once you arrive! There are small restaurants and cafÃ©s within walking distance, and it takes about 25â€“30 minutes by taxi to reach Sapa town.
Lo was incredibly kind, helpful, and responded quickly to all our messages. We felt very welcome and weâ€™d love to come back again!

Our stay with Lo was truly unforgettable, and my partner and I had such a wonderful experience. Waking up to that breathtaking view is a memory we will cherish forever. We also feel incredibly grateful for the opportunity to explore the local area and participate in a trek that Lo helped organize for us. Stepping away from the main area of Sapa allowed us to connect with the beauty around us in a special way. We wholeheartedly recommend this experience to anyone looking to create lasting memories!

Lo was the best host!
He was very responsive and helpful with local recommendations.
The cabin was in a very beautiful part of town and had a lovely view.
I enjoyed trekking with the local women and learning about their culture. Lots of incredible nearby restaurants.
Very comfortable and lovely stay! Amazing view of the countryside from the bungalow and very accommodating hosts.
Lovely accommodation with a view on the rice fields. Spacious and quiet. Totally recommend

Room is just right for 2 people and looks exactly how it is in pictures. Lo and the care taker are very friendly and responsive, they just live next door so they can assist in everything. They are flexible on the check in and out too.

I had a wonderful stay. The private room was spacious, cozy, and spotlessâ€”truly great value for money.

We had a beautiful time and cant wait to retourn!

A Hidden Gem in the Heart of Sapa ğŸŒ¿
I had the pleasure of staying at this beautiful eco-luxury homestay in Sapa, Lao Cai, hosted by the warm and welcoming Thi Houng. Surrounded by lush greenery and peaceful mountains, this retreat blends comfort, sustainability, and authentic Vietnamese hospitality. The thoughtfully designed villas and the stunning swimming pool overlooking the valley offer pure serenity. Every detail reflects a deep respect for nature. Thi Houng went above and beyond to make our stay memorableâ€”sharing local tips and helping plan nearby adventures. Her genuine care truly stands out. If youâ€™re looking to unwind, connect with nature, and enjoy a touch of luxury, this is the place. Perfect for couples, solo travelers, or anyone seeking peace in Vietnamâ€™s mountains.

Every time I go to a place, the first thing that I check is the bathroom. And this place has the cleanest bathroom that I have seen. The room is so tidy and smells really good. I like how peaceful the place is but still near along the sapa town center, it is really accessible and easy to locate. Quang is so accommodating and hospitable, a really nice host. He responds fast to our queries. If we ever travel to Sa Pa again, we will for sure book this place again.

We had a very nice stay here. The place is charming and the room, though small, was cozy and comfortable. The bed was a little firm, but everything else was great. The location is excellent â€” very close to the church and in a quiet area, yet just a short and easy walk to the town center.
Quang was very kind and helpful throughout our stay. Overall, a lovely experience!

Similar to other reviews, room was a little cool due to inclement weather outside which affected dryness of towel or clothes.  But I LOVED the heated bed which was a major plus in my book.  Quang was extremely hospitable as I was able to leave my big bag with him for a couple of days while trekking in the village and was always responsive. He even helped me find a place after to keep my bags several more hours for free as he was closed for the evening.  2min walk to Sapa station and church and very conveniently located.  Great stay for me.

Great location, good communication. We arrived early in the morning and check in instructions were clear. We requested breakfast one morning and it was yummy and well priced (35k each). Would definitely recommend.
The room was just like in the pictures, very clean and spacious. I got to the hostel very late at night and the host was extremely accommodating and responsive. Would book again!

I really enjoyed my stay here! The place was spacious, clean and looked exactly like the pictures. The bed had heating available, linens were clean and smelt amazing too.

Maiâ€™s house showcases traditional Hâ€™mong house architecture. Though not far from the center of Sapa, it remains peacefully secluded from the bustling tourist spots. This is a beautiful stay in a traditional Hmong village. Mr.Chu is a great cook, and his wife was very kind as well. A great place to explore Hâ€™Mong culture and cuisine , great views of Fansipan, very peaceful surroundings. We have access to a beautiful spring, the view from the slopes leading there is breathtaking. Mr Chu prepares very good meals with local fresh ingredients. We enjoyed our stay a great deal. Highly recommend this home stay. It is a very peaceful escape from Sa Pa! It is also very comfortable with a flush toilet, hot water, and soap. The space is gorgeous like in the photos and the meals were diverse and outstanding. The host family was nice and made us feel comfortable. For clarity, the location is in Google Maps under Mai Mai Homestay (it took us a while to receive the location information so we had to backtrack on our bikes).
I'm very pleased with my experience at Smoke Valley

What can I say that hasn't been said already? This was a truly wonderful experience.  Zung responds quickly to any questions, will help arrange whatever you need. I went largely with the idea of going to a quiet, interesting and tranquil place to write, and this worked perfectly. Oh, and the food is wonderful,  very generous portions, fresh as you can get it. I feel truly privileged to have been able to spend time in this lovely community with wonderful people and to have been introduced to the Hmong community.

We had a very nice stay for two nights! The accommodation was simple but everything you need. Mr. Chu and his family were welcoming and fed us so much yummy food! We wandered around the village and enjoyed the beautiful scenery. I would recommend to anyone looking for something off the beaten path!

Maiâ€™s house itâ€™s the best airbnb experiece we ever had. If you want to know a bit more about hmong comunity this is the right place. Chuâ€™s family has been super kind with us, itâ€™s been a pleasure share the meals with them. We will always think of Xin Chai as the best stop of our trip in Vietnam. Would highly recommend!

I travel a  lot and love non touristy off the beaten track places. This is the very best local/authentic stays Iâ€™ve ever had. To me, I felt like I was transported into the pages of a national geographic magazine. Amazing views, local life - chickens, pigs, dogs, ducks, water Buffalo, etc.  If you are wondering- the place has stone floors but is spotless. The walls are wooden slats but I never saw a â€˜creatureâ€™ ie. mouse, etc. inside or outside. The shower is hot. Taxi will easily take you to Sapa if you want to go. Trekking is amazing with the host (my daughter was so excited because she got to see China). The food is AMAZING, plentiful and healthy. Great vegetarian options. The hosts are beautiful, welcoming people. Taxi service that was recommended was also super helpful. Stayed here with my 16 year old daughter and we both felt safe walking the street, hiking whether alone or together. This is a great community- nobody tries to sell you anything and they just go about their lives.

Even though we had read previous reviews, our whole family was still surprised when we came to stay. Every arrangement in the house made us feel cozy and close to home while still feeling the characteristics of the H'MOng people. Mr. Chu's family, everyone is friendly. In addition to eating hot and delicious meals with his family, we also enjoyed typical H'Mong dishes during the Lunar New Year. Located in a village that is not a crowded tourist area, the whole family can feel the natural scenery of the surrounding landscape and people. The fresh air, friendly people, clean, cozy house and delicious food made us initially plan to stay 2 nights, then decided to stay 1 more night. I also had a very special experience trying on H'Mong women's costumes. Unforgettable cultural experiences for the whole family. We plan to return here during the ripe rice season to harvest rice with Uncle Chu's family.

Mai Mai homestay in Sin Chai is a great place to relax. The house is beautifully decorated (probably the nicest place I stayed in the northern mountains of Vietnam), but keep in mind that it is made like this for tourists, since mountain ethnics usually do not care so much about that.
Our stay was very comfortable (beds, bathroom, cleanliness, etc.), usually accommodations are more basic. The houses can accommodate 6 persons (3 double beds).
Thereâ€™s an easy 3 hour trek path in the surroundings, but after that hiking itineraries are demanding since it is located near Fansipan mountain range.
Communication with Mai could not be better! Thank you!

what an amazing place to stay. friendly, beautiful, quiet... perfect!!!
beautiful land!

Mai's house is more than just an Airbnb. It is a lifetime experience. Hands down, this is the best experience I have ever had in Airbnb. Mr. Chu and his family took care of me really well despite the communication barrier. I stayed for 3 nights, but wished could stay longer. The place is beautiful, and peaceful. This is definitely a place to relax and rejuvenate.
In the day time, Mr. Chu's family invited me to plant corn seeds at the farm on the mountain. After farming, they would invite me to the family lunch with abundance of food and rice wine and family time. What I like the most is that, none of the activities or experience is curated. It all felt natural based on our own effort to communicate with them and to be part of their community.
Will definitely come again for sure!

Si vous cherchez le confort, ce logement nâ€™est pas pour vous. En hiver, malgrÃ© le feu et les bouillottes, il fait trÃ¨s froid. Mais nous avons vÃ©cu une expÃ©rience extraordinaire Ã  Sin Chai : en suivant les conseils de Zung, nous sommes allÃ©s Ã  la rencontre des habitants ; nous avons Ã©tÃ© invitÃ©s Ã  dÃ©jeuner par le Bible study group, nous avons assistÃ© Ã  une cÃ©rÃ©monie rituelle pour chasser les esprits mauvais (incroyable), nous avons partagÃ© les repas de Za, Chu et Lan, le mari de Lan nous a jouÃ© de la musiqueâ€¦ Câ€™Ã©tait une immersion totale et probablement le souvenir le plus marquant de nos trois mois en Asie.
a really beautiful place where ypu can find a real Sapa people's life.
A great place to disconnect from the hustle and bustle of a life in the city

It was a wonderful, peaceful experience at Longâ€™s home. He was not on the property but kept checking in about our stay and addressed any concerns promptly. He even arranged a driver to bring us from the main market to the Homestay on the day of our arrival. The place is a little far from the center so he offered a free motorbike too! For a clean, spacious, getaway it is a must visit :)

All we can say is WOW. Not only is the cabin and location beautiful, but Long and Giangg are wonderful hosts who truly care about their guests' experience. Long is very hospitable and welcoming and gave us excellent local recommendations.
The cabin itself is perched on a hill overlooking rice paddies, right next to a small local farm. You wake up each morning to the beautiful sounds of nature and can enjoy your coffee overlooking the peaceful valley. It's well stocked for longer stays, and all the furniture is very comfortable. Wifi is also great! One thing to note is that this is not all one house, but rather 3 separate suites, each suite with one bedroom.
The location is perfect if you are looking for a peaceful atmosphere. It's about a 15min drive out of Sa Pa town, and as long as you have transportation, it's absolutely perfect. We only wish we would have spent 1 month here. Thank you, Long & Giangg for everything ğŸ™â¤ï¸
It was a nice and peaceful stay.

Wundervolle Oase der Ruhe nahe Sapa!
Wir hatten einen absolut fantastischen Aufenthalt in dieser Unterkunft in Taphin! Die Lage, nur etwa 15 Minuten vom Zentrum Sapas entfernt, war perfekt fÃ¼r uns. Wir haben die herrliche Natur und die unglaubliche Ruhe in dieser Gegend sehr genossen â€“ eine willkommene Abwechslung zum Trubel.

Besonders hervorheben mÃ¶chten wir unseren Gastgeber. Er war unglaublich hilfsbereit, gab uns tolle Empfehlungen fÃ¼r Unternehmungen in der Umgebung und hat sich sofort um kleinere Anliegen gekÃ¼mmert. Als besonderes Highlight hat er uns sogar zu einem kÃ¶stlichen, lokalen Abendessen eingeladen â€“ eine wirklich nette Geste, die unseren Aufenthalt noch unvergesslicher gemacht hat.
Wir haben uns rundum wohlgefÃ¼hlt und kÃ¶nnen diese Unterkunft jedem wÃ¤rmstens empfehlen.
Very peaceful place to stay!
Clean & comfortable room. Stunning views from our room. Staff was welcoming & helpful. Lots of food options for the breakfast buffet.
The place is nice we expected that there is a swimming pool and a room close to the overlooking train. But overall the place is nice.

The hotel is well located near Sapa Museum and Sapa Station within 10 min walk and there are lots of great restaurants to choose from. We were unlucky with cold, foggy weather and the hotel could have been warmer as doors and windows were left open and there was little heating but we realise it is winter time.

David was a great host! Responded very quickly, and was very accommodating to our needs/requests. Check-in instructions were super detailed and helpful.
The apartment was very clean and well stocked. We could not have asked for a better location. Overall a wonderful place; we would stay here again easily!

The place is so nice just a walkinh distance to sapa train station going to fansipan. We upgraded our room to vip room and the view was so nice. We can see the train passing by.

I enjoyed my stay in Sa Pa! Thanks to all of the staff who helped me the entire stay. Always there to help and the location is near to Sun Plaza station! The place is very clean and everyone is friendly and nice. This place is highly recommended!

Sadly the typhoon had just happened so the swimming pool was out of action. This was one of the main reasons for booking. It would have been nice to have been informed so I could have made a decision of going or not. Breakfast was great on last day but poor on the others again because of typhoon and lack of guests. Everything seemed closed.
The views were magnificent and the location was perfect.
Room was beautifully appointed.
Tv was great for films. Especially Box 24 channel as they were in English.
Would I stay here again absolutely and hopefully next time I can enjoy the facilities fully.
Great place to stay with great views
Fantastic location with stunning views. Ha Huu Khoa, the manager was very accommodating. sort out our transfer to and from La Caio.  Clean room with decent breakfast.
great value, along the road to the place you can find a lot of motorbike rentals

I had a lovely visit and stayed  five nights.   I had one concern on the first day and they resolved the problem immediately. My room was absolutely lovely with an incredible porch and view of the valley. It was incredibly relaxing place to stay.  The bathroom and the room were perfectly clean.  The large deck is exactly as you see it and is splendid place to sit with coffee or a beer.  The location is within easy walking distance of anywhere you would want to go, including the lake and some of the nearby walks. I would happily stay here again.  Thank you so much for such a great visit.

Great location! We loved the view of the mountains and train. The staff was very attentive and allowed us to check in early for a small fee, which included delicious pho. Thanks again! We hope to be back.

Very communicative & helpful!

The room is amazing with a breathtaking with the view of the mountain with the train that goes to Fansipan right in front of the window â¤ï¸
David is an amazing host thank you so much for everything and Iâ€™ll see you soon again I promise â¤ï¸
David was great at communication and the service was top tier, room is cozy and it has a nice sized tv great views of the train and great breakfast selection. Would stay here again.

I requested a room with the best view for my birthday solo trip to make it really special. Iâ€™m so grateful that I was given an amazing room where you can see the mountains and the Fansipan train right from the window. The room is huge, and the bathroom is clean with a working heater.
The hotel is also close to some great spots, and the views are breathtaking. This hotel has one of the best views of Sapa.
What Iâ€™m especially thankful for is when I lost my purse with my passport at Fansipan. I sought help from the General Manager, Mr. Ha Huu Khoa, who helped me find it. Thanks to him, I was able to retrieve my purse from customer service at SunPlaza.
Highly recommended!
loved my stay and will definitely come back had a great time in the area and the morning views was just amazing.
Accomodation and Service is very remarkable. We look forward to stay at JoVille Hotel once we return to Sa Pa.

Our stay at Joville Hotel exceeded all expectations! Located in a relatively new building, we were thrilled to find the best offer available. A huge shoutout to our fantastic host, Huu Khoa, who went above and beyond to fulfill our dream room request â€“ a stunning view from the monorail railway. Tower B provided us with the most breathtaking scenery, making our stay truly dreamy.
Special thanks to the male receptionist who assisted us throughout our stay. Despite the language barrier, he made every effort to communicate effectively, ensuring we felt welcome and attended to.
While the room was a bit chilly and lacked a heater, the hot and cold shower more than made up for it. Overall, our experience at Joville Hotel was nothing short of magical. We cannot wait to return and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Sapa. Many thanks to the entire team for making our stay unforgettable!
Ruhige Ecke und eine wunderbare Aussicht . Die Leute waren sehr hilfsbereit und die Kumulation funktionierte gut .

Hungs place was absolutely gorgeous. We felt very welcomed by the family and even had dinner with them. not only was the place super cozy and had an amazing view, but it also was a nice cultural exchange. Hung is one of the most friendly hosts iâ€™ve had the pleasure of meeting with so far!

This is a true Vietnamese family home stay. Hung his wife & amazing 2 young boys ( great interpreters) were the best host. The breakfast that are included were different every day & tasty. We stayed with them for dinner 1 night for a feast of Vietnamese culinary delight, from the fresh fish to the homemade spring rolls to the amazing vegetables, for 3 big lads from Canadian we were stuffed. And copious amounts of Hungâ€™s homemade Plum wine. They drove us into town when we wanted but we enjoyed the magnificent beauty of being 5000 ft up on the side of the mountain over looking the valley below and staying around his home. Great coffee and views just up the road but the coffee at home was excellent. Recommend this 100% on your list, very rustic & a bit to get to but this family makes it worth the trip.
The house is not too far from town and the view to the valley is amazing. The owner is an architect and he build his house from wood with unique design.

The house was at a very beautiful location and the view at night was breathtaking and awesome. The location made the stay even more memorable and joyful. Would highly recommend to stay with this host.
The most beautiful house on the hill we could have imagined.  The family was so lovely.  Canâ€™t wait to go back.

This house is ideal if you want to experience the real life of Vietnamese people. We had an amazing stay. House is handbuilt with many quirky features. The views were amazing and Hung, Linh and family are wonderful hosts. Perfect spot to switch off, enjoy the local culture and beautiful food made by Linh. It is rustic, peaceful and one of pufavourite stays ever. Hung is very helpful with transport in and out of Sapa which is only 5kms away
Higkly recommended ğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜Š
Very niceâ€¦

Amazing hospitality. Very patient if you donâ€™t know Vietnamese. I hurt my leg on a motorbike and they gave me a local topical remedy and treated me like family.
Extreme comfort when we needed it most! Location is perfect for incredible views. They are very helpful with transportation. The food is some of best we have ever had in Vietnam! We will be back.

Really cool and unique place! A nice blend of traditional Vietnamese house western style on the 2nd floor. I don't think the pictures do it the justice it should. But the space you have is cool, there's a living room with fireplace, bathroom area, and 3 separate rooms - 1 an attic like room. The location isn't the best, but that's clear from the airbnb profile. It's a great space if you want to get away with friends and have a cosy place to stay.

I had a wonderful stay at Sapa Fansipan View Hotel! The location is perfect, with stunning views of the mountains and easy access to the town center. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful throughout my visit. The room was clean, cozy, and comfortableâ€”just what I needed after a day of exploring. Highly recommend for anyone visiting Sapa!

Perfect location and amazing pool! Just a 4-minute walk to Moana Sapa and 11 minutes to Sun World Plaza (a bit of an uphill walk, but doable!). Tucked away enough to be peaceful at night, but still close to the town center. The pool was absolutely stunningâ€¦highlight of our stay! Daily housekeeping was a nice touch, and the room was clean, cozy, and comfortable. The staff were super friendly and helpful. We honestly couldnâ€™t have asked for a better place to stay in Sapa!

Highly recommend staying here while youâ€™re in Sa Pa. Just a 2 min walk from SaPa Moana, lots of great food just down the hill, the scenery is beautiful, the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, our host was great as well, responsiveness was quick the recommendations, accommodations and support was above and beyond, especially with the HBD surprise for my GF they even made a cake along with the swan and roses in blown away!

Initially we weren't informed that all guests are required to show their passport to check in, which we had to spend sometime finding a copy which delayed the check in. When that happened, the 3rd person waited for the supposed 15minutes for the water to heat up, but then the warm water only lasted 3minutes, and the rest had to shower in ice cold water, which was a huge deal breaker for us. Honestly, the best amazing place to stay! I will always recommend this place to everyone visiting Vietnam. We couldnâ€™t stop looking at the views - picturesque! Thank you so much to everyone who made our trip special. P.s have the pancakes for breakfast!

I canâ€™t find words to express the amount of joy I had in this place starting from  the stuff they are so kind helpful the place and the view is outstanding highly recommended the best place to stay in sapa

This place looks just like the pictures. The views and property are gorgeous! If you wondering why itâ€™s called Glamping, there were some bugs that could get into the room, but other than that itâ€™s more of a luxury hotel!
Amazing accomodation, the view and facilities were brilliant. The staff were very welcoming and joyful. Would highly recommend staying here, I donâ€™t think youâ€™d be able to find a better view.

We had a pleasant stay at phansi - the location was beautiful and the place was very peaceful- breakfast also included! Only thing I would like to add is the attentiveness of the staff could be better when customers are at the check in or reception.
Secondly, worth noting that it takes 5-7 mins with the buggy to get inside the accomodation- they are fairly responsive but it does add to the time. The location is right next to Moana (walkable!) but for anything else, you will need a taxi as itâ€™s uphill and not an easy walk!
We had such an amazing stay, the place was absolutely stunning and all accommodations were perfect! Everyone was so welcoming and friendly! Would definitely reccomend to anyone visiting Sa Pa!

This glamping experience is a great way to spend some quiet time in Sapa! Hosts are super responsive and happy to help with luggage and drop offs/ pick ups on the main road due to the location being a little out of the way for taxis. The only drawbacks were a plumbing issue that required me to move tents, and poor wifi at the second tent location. However, still a 5/5 rating for location, views, and easy communication with hosts!
Great place to stay at! The view from the lodge is unique and spectacular. The team serving us were attentive and took care of us well too. I highly recommend this for your stay at Sapa!

Staying at Phansi was really awesome. The views were spectacular. The service was premium. Huong and the rest of the staff were very nice. The restaurant and bar being at the same place was really convenient. Breakfast was lovely. They provided bike rentals at the venue for the price you get outside and the bikes were in much better condition and we did not need to walk far or look around for one.
We got there when it was full moon and everything was gorgeous. at night you get to see the city from a far which looks like a really nice steampunk city.
We really enjoyed our stay. The views, staff, service. Was definitely worth it.

We stayed at this place for 3 nights and we would come back everytime. The view from the balcony ist amazing and breathtaking. The view is even better as on the pictures. The stuff members are super friendly and helpfull. Not all of them speak englisch but it was never a problem because they help you or reach out to someone else. You can also eat at the Restaurant there and it was delicious. They have a shuttle service and they can drive you up and down because the road to the Phansi is not made for cars. The service was for free and available kind of all the time. Thanks again for this beautiful experiance.

The place was absolutely great
But unfortunately the path to Phansi was not that smooth for those with child and baby
The buggy service was quite slow especially when night time
Otherwise the staff was absolutely polite and helpful

I recently stayed at an underrated spot in Sapa, Vietnam, and it truly felt like home. This place gives you the sensation of being on top of the mountain, surrounded by fog and tranquility. Everything about it is simply perfect. The food is delicious, and you definitely shouldnâ€™t miss their egg coffeeâ€”itâ€™s a must-try! The rooms are spotless, and the location, a bit away from the hustle and bustle, serves a purpose. If youâ€™re looking for a peaceful escape amidst the mountains, this is the ideal place to unwind.

we had a great time at Huong's. The staff is very reactive, friendly and welcoming. the view from the deck is amazing and well worth the trip. we also enjoyed the tasty breakfast. we would recommend this location to anyone visiting Sa Pa

Beautiful place to stay and so relaxing! The location is great if you want a more peaceful stay in Sapa but still want to access the town. The cabins were beautiful and the views were amazing, the food was also great!
i think the stay was really amazing! just that the weather didnâ€™t allow us to see the clouds sadly. the bbq was sooooo good too! remember to get the bbq set when youâ€™re there

I love staying here. Mr Home and his staff are very nice, helpful and friendly.

Highly recommended!!

The view from the accommodation was absolutely breathtaking! From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed. They provided great recommendations for things to do in the area and even arranged motorcycles for us to use for the day.
A true highlight was the outstanding breakfast â€“ not only was it delicious, but the view from both the breakfast area and our room was simply spectacular.
We felt completely at home and would definitely come back!

Our cabin at Phansi was a dream! Stunning 360 views, friendly & helpful staff, peaceful location, and all services available to us. This place was exactly what we wanted for a tranquil, romantic getaway. Definite recommend :)
Lovely place, slightly out of town but they provide buggy services. The Cafe was super nice to just spend the day at
Lovely stay in Phansi. The view was absolutely stunning, and the service was impeccable. Great responsiveness from our host!

Het was een erg fijn verblijf bij Phansi, de kamer had erg mooi uitzicht en het personeel was super vriendelijk en behulpzaam!
Het enige nadeel was voor ons dat het bed erg hard was, waardoor we wat minder lekker sliepen.

We loved our stay here. The views are absolutely incredible and the little e-buggy ride down really adds to the secluded feel. The restaurant area is lovely and all the staff are super friendly. We particularly want to thank Susan who was always really kind and helpful to us! Would 100% recommend.

The place is Beautiful! The view is unbeatable, Iâ€™ve had the best time chilling and enjoying.
Wish they were a little more flexible with the check in if the room is ready early.
But still would 100% recommend this place. Beautiful view and the most cozy cabin/ dome, and theyâ€™ve got great restaurant, lovely staffs and good all round services.

My boyfriend and I got to stay here during our trip to Sapa and this place is literally unreal. The views itself made it 100000% worth it. I am absolutely mesmerised by this place. I have never seen a sunset like that in my life, if you haven't been to Sa Pa you should definitely come. Apart from the cosy, clean glamping with everything you need, I would like to mention the terrace overlooking the mountains and rice fields and the very friendly staff. I will definitely be back.

Our glamping stay in Sapa was truly unforgettable. The tent was cozy, well-equipped, and offered breathtaking views of the mountains and rice terraces. The hosts were incredibly kind and attentive, making us feel right at home and helping with everything. This is the perfect blend of comfort and nature â€” highly recommended for anyone looking to experience Sapa in a unique and peaceful way!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this place! Place was clean with an amazing view.
Host was very friendly, making our stay very enjoyable.
Only downside was the inconvenient location, as it is a steep walk to and from the airbnb. They did offer free shuttle service up to main road whenever u call/inform them~

Massive thank you to Huong for letting us stay at her gorgeous place at Phansi! We made the right decision booking this place at Sapa! It was my favourite accomodation that I booked throughout Vietnam. The place was overlooking the rice fields, exactly what the photos showed and I felt really comfortable during our stay, staff was so friendly and we had a great time with all of them! Huong was easy to communicate with and helped us throughout! I definitely will be back here again!

The place is a little bit out of the way for travellers, however itâ€™s just perfect as it offers lots of peace and serenity with it being a little further from the main town area. It was a beautiful place to stay, the hosts were lovely and so accommodating. The location was slightly out of Sapa town but still within walking distance. Would definitely stay here again!

The place had great views. Did not need to take a trekking trip through the rice fields because it was just there in front of us. Host was accommodating.  The cat is cute too!  11/10 would book again!

One of the best airbnbs Iâ€™ve been to especially for the price. He totally undersells it. The view right from the room is beautiful. We had horses go right past the back. Nous avons passÃ© un super sÃ©jour chez Anh. Tout Ã©tait super !! La maison nâ€™est pas facile Ã  trouver et se situe Ã  30 minutes en voiture du centre de Sa Pa ! Merci pour votre accueil et rÃ©activitÃ©

We booked all 3 rooms for a our group of 4, the location is close to a Village called Ta Van which is on the Trekking route, there's great cafes & restaurants a short walk away for food. The views are absolutely breathtaking. It's about a 25 mins taxi from Sapa town, we managed to get a Grab for our whole stay, a car or bike is needed if you wanted to explore the area. There was a couple of land slides when we went but this didn't seem to stop the drivers.
the rooms are very simple, but beds are clean and comfy, the shower does produce some hot water even though the listing says it doesn't, there are a lot of bugs due to being right next to the the rice paddies, and there's no air con but a fan is provided. we did notice a little bit of mould on the walls, this could be caused by the rainy season.
The hosts are super kind, they waited until 8pm for us to arrive, they also have a really cool souvenir shop above from local artists, we all bought something, absolutely would recommend!!

Anhâ€™s place is extremely beautiful and peaceful, the view youâ€™ll wake up to every morning is amazing. My family and I arrived at Sapa at 5am in the morning and Anh was actively messaging me making sure we were able to find the place. When we arrived, he greeted us with a smile and helped us check in.
There are 3 rooms total, I personally slept in bedroom 3, and the only downside I would say is there are a lot of insects because the toiletâ€™s ventilation was a hole in the wall. If you donâ€™t prefer insects, I will suggest sleeping in bedroom 1 and 2!
Overall, I really enjoyed my stay with my family here and it is a view I will never get back home <3
The accommodation was very good! The guys have a store on top with cool tees and hoodies with unique designs!

My friends and I booked Anh's place to stay for a couple of days so that we could experience the true Sa Pa villages away from the main hustle and bustle of the town, and we are so glad that we did! Anh was very responsive from the beginning and even helped to arrange a taxi to come and collect us from our last place and bring us to the Air bnb. He also got two scooters for us so that we were able to ride around the village. The rooms themselves were so cosy and beautifully designed - we were all extra happy with the electric blankets as it could get really cold at night. There are also heaters in each room and hot showers so we never felt cold after a day out in the rain. If you are looking for a peaceful, relaxing place to stay in one of the Hmong villages, I would 100% recommend Anh's place. Thank you so much for making our trip so special :)

We were shocked when we arrived at the Airbnb. The pictures already looked amazing, but once we arrived it was so much better than we had hoped. Big open windows of the rice fields (which I hope Anh will put more clearly in the preview, because waking up to the sunrise when we decided not to cover the window blinds was the best decision) and easy access to several hikes which we decided to take! Sapa was amazing, but seeing this town was even better. Some of our friends decided to extend their stay once they realised that the bed had a warmer function we didn't know about before arrival. We decided to go hiking without a guide, and locals helped us find the right paths when we were at forks in the road. The supermarkets were in easy walking distance and open until 21. The nearby restaurants also had amazing food with very generous portions. We were able to sit down and have coffees while talking to some very nice people we met while we were here.
The views from the Airbnb were very pretty and the host was extremely helpful
very nice place in the paddy fields perfect place if u want to escape the city and really soak in the nature
Great place to stay. Ahn is very friendly
Good view and local experience
Nice new rooms that are well cleaned. There is always someone around the house to help you. Only slight drawback is location next to the main street.

Amazing little hide-out up in the mountains. This place is a little paradise up in the mountains. We loved our stay with Van, it is truly peaceful up there. It takes 20 minutes to hike up, but it is totally worth it. The sunset is right in front of the guest house, with amazing views over the valley. Van cookes great food and takes care of you while you are there.

Staying with Van was beautiful!
If youâ€™re looking to get away from the tourist spots (and away from people in general) to have a rural Vietnamese adventure, then this is definitely the spot for you. Just getting driven up the mountain to her place was an adventure! Exploring the hills and town was lovely. The local hot spring baths are great for a dip (especially while surrounded by those mountain views).
I travelled in via bus/motorbike/walking and had a great time. But would probably recommend this place to people with their own transport.
Van was an amazing host, I was a bit disorganised but she was able to help me out a ton (everyone please remember to bring enough cash with you from the city, there are barely any ATMs out here and a lot of them donâ€™t work with international cards).

Thank you so much Van for one of the most unforgettable stays in Vietnam. Van has created something truly special with this Airbnb! The Airbnb is located on a lovely property and the sunsets from the room were incredible.

Van is super helpful. Although the place is remote, it would not make you disappointed. We had a good rest there and had small hikes there with lovely dogs (raise by Van). Highly recommend to all Eco-lodge lovers.
Unser Besuch bei Van war wirklich besonders! Weg von dem Massentourismus, ein bisschen im Nirgendwo - super schÃ¶n! Es dauert bis man dort ist, aber die Reise hat sich gelohnt!

Our stay with Van was truly unique and beautiful. It was unlike any other Airbnb experience weâ€™ve had. The accommodation on the mountain was stunning, and living with Van felt very authentic. The food she prepared was absolutely delicious, and we thoroughly enjoyed having conversations with her. Her dogs and cats were also incredibly charming!
For future visitors, I would recommend bringing plenty of snacks with you, as there are no dining options in the surrounding area. Be mindful of the insects, though!
We are also incredibly grateful to Van for her help with our arrival and departure. We encountered a few issues, but she was always available and provided us with great assistance.
We are so happy about our time with Van and would do it all over again â™¥ï¸
This place was perfect. Isolated and away from everyone. Exactly what was needed.

Van was also incredibly helpful in arranging my travel to and from the homestay. Thank you for everything and I can't recommend enough to other nature lovers and those looking for a peaceful stay in the outdoors.

Vanâ€™s place is amazing! Itâ€™s the most gorgeous airbnb Iâ€™ve seen. What a stay! Anyone who wants some peace and quiet at the edge of Vietnam, disconnect from the outside world - this is the place to go.
A tip for future travelers: use Maps' satellite mode to find Van's lovely home more easily because it can get be a little tricky doing so without any internet.
She was kind enough to prepare dinner and breakfast for me and the whole stay/place felt something out of Studio Ghibli animation - couldn't recommend it more!

Itâ€™s an adventure to get there but itâ€™s worth it for the beautiful view and lovely host! I recommended to anyone who is looking to get away from the busy areas and have a quiet peaceful time. Next time we would stay three nights and visit the waterfall and hot springs!

Unfortunately we were only at Van's accommodation for one day on our motorcycle tour, but that one day was so idyllic and exactly as beautiful as described! This wonderful accommodation with a breathtaking view is located at the top of a mountain, secluded among home-grown vegetables! It has everything you need in such a quiet place. You can really relax here! We went for a walk through the fields with their three dogs and in the evening we had dinner together with Van. She prepared super tasty and simple vegetarian food for us, thank you for that!
Don't underestimate the walk up! It's not a problem on foot, but it takes about 30 minutes. It's quicker to get to the top on a motorcycle, but the road is a challenge and you have to be very careful on the way down... it can be very difficult when it rains.
But this was also described by Van and is really the only thing you need to know!
We would have loved to stay one more night in this peaceful place!
Beautiful and peaceful place. Amazing nature, very friendly pets. Van is very kind  person. Her home was wonderful. Thank you so much ğŸ˜Š

This was the highlight of our stay, Be aware yes itâ€™s an adventure to get there but the view is absolutely worth it. we extended our stay, because we loved it so much. We arrived at night and we did not know so we hike for so long in the dark but the host explained to us that we can grab a moto bike taxi if we donâ€™t want to hike. we are the only ones on the mountain and you are in a indigenous village where tourists donâ€™t come often. We were the only ones there and it was an amazing experience. People were really friendly. The host, van is amazing at first she seems a bit shy but she is really kind. she helped us so much during our stay. She answered all ours questions, she helped us to rent a motobike , to book a bus and a taxi motobike. She is amazing. She invited us in her home and she cooked for us for a small fee. Her cooking is insanely good & healthy. The bungalow is just perfect super eco friendly. I will never forget her two dogs, they were so friendly and cute.

Beautiful new hotel  with friendly staff and fantastic views. Spotlessly clean, comfortably slept 3 of us and bikes were safe parked out front. Dinner not to English taste (travelling with my dad) but well presented and staff very helpful in offering an alternative. Swimming pool was a great addition to our stay.

Our family enjoyed a restful stay at MÆ°á»ng LÃ² Retreat after two weeks of traveling. The staff is extremely hospitable from the moment you arrive, always friendly, soft-spoken, and smiling. Breakfast and afternoon tea is included, and the restaurant serves very good dinner (upon reservation) with large portions, as well as simple lunch. Although we didn't come in the best season (the staff said August-September is more beautiful) we loved waking up to the view of the valley and town. Beautiful location and stunning views.  Food is great. Only thing to mention for guests staying in the Dormatory is that it is right above the restaurant and you can hear everything. My rest was based on when the activity in the restaurant stopped and started.

Definitely an aesthetically pleasing lodging facility for cloud-hunters in Ta Xua! The sheer rawness and relative lack of development in the area makes it one of the very few places left in Vietnam where foreign tourists are more of an exception than the rule. The ecolodge itself is a nice spot to relax, unwind and observe nature in all its brilliancy. However, if youâ€™re here for cloud-hunting, bewareâ€”the roads, especially the back-end of the Dinosaur Spine peak may make you crap your pants if youâ€™ve no experience in mountain-biking. Highly recommend hiring motorbike taxis if thatâ€™s the case.
Also, come prepared if youâ€™re vegan/vegetarian; I was expecting little to no options at their restaurant and thatâ€™s indeed the case. The staff are friendly though, but only one of them speaks conversant English. As a rule, always carry cash in Vietnam; cards arenâ€™t accepted here. Remember, this is remote Vietnam!
Overall, if you have realistic expectations, this place wonâ€™t disappoint you.

Amazing homestay experience! Thanh Nga and her wonderful family, including their adorable pets, cat Butter and dog Black, were fantastic hosts at their fabulous homestay. The homestay is perfection. The hosts were energetic, friendly and happy. The views and food were fabulous.
My partner, who has something to say about everything, was completely smitten with the place and keeps talking about going back.
I was sick a lot from a previous place and the rooms are clean and lovely and as far as being sick on holiday goes, the homestay made it very bearable.

Mr Nam and his wife were excellent hosts and their home stay in La Pan Tan is glorious. Beautiful surroundings and walking routes along the valley. Room was clean and comfortable with a lovely view across the valley and the food was superb. Nam came to collect us from the road and arranged our onward transport for us. Amazing hospitality and value - would recommend!

Leuk huisje midden tussen de rijstvelden. We hebben 4 dagen doorgebracht bij Nam en zijn familie in het mooie Mu Cang Chai. Een prachtige omgeving waar je mooie wandelingen kan maken door de rijstterrassen en kleine dorpjes. Nam en zijn familie zijn heel gastvrij en relaxed. Zijn vrouw kan zeer goed koken, we hebben iedere avond hier gegeten en iedere dag werd er anders gekookt en alles supervers. Nam reageert ook zeer snel via telefoon en kan alles voor je regelen ook de transport heen of terug, heel handig. We hebben die 4 dagen amper toeristen gezien en het voelde heel authentiek aan. Een echte aanrader en een heel lieve familie!

Nam is the best host that you can wish for, he has show me all the beatifull places in mi cang chai and also invited me to a party from the neighbors.
The food was also really Nice, nams wife has cooked every day for me and it was Nice and a lot.
Go to this place !

Lapantan Paradise is absolutely worth staying. I looked at a few others and in fact saw a couple whilst there. Glad we chose this one.
The food cooked by Nam's wife (sorry i forgot her name) is amazing. She's the best cook we've found on our trip so far. Delicious. And quite a variety (we atayed 2 nights). Oh and stay 2-3 nights if you can. Nam will agow you where to walk. Best rice fields are in La Pan Tan.

If you turn right if you look to the fields there is an awesome out and back trail. Highly recommend.

We absolutely loved our stay in Mu Cang Chai even though we visited during winter. The rice terraces were still stunning even though it was â€œoff season â€œ. It was possibly the best time during our four week trip in Vietnam.

We also had some of our best meals in Vietnam there prepared by Namâ€™s wife. Bring your appetite as the food is delicious and plentiful.
We arrived from Ninh Binh and were not able to make it time for the bus to MCC from Hanoi, so Nam helped us arrange a private transfer from Yen Bai.
We look forward to coming back to this unique place!

We had pleasant experience staying at Lapantan Paradise. We also tried Nam's wife homemade food which was delicious. Behind the accommodation, there were rice terraces in walking distance so you don't have to travel far. Nam was also very helpful and accommodated us with motorbike tour around Mu Cang Chai and all attractions.

We viewed several apartments at The Song and this one stood out as the best by far. It was cozy, clean, and well cared for. If you have a mold allergy, we recommend sticking to the lower floors like this one on the 9th floor, everything above 12 seemed hit or miss. This one felt much better than others we saw.
The balcony was a highlight, our favorite spot to unwind at night, with a nice table and chairs for relaxing and morning coffee. Also perfect for working. Laundry was clean and thereâ€™s a large drying rack on the balcony which came in very handy.
Supermarket in walking distance. Cafe right in the courtyard. Motorbike rental was super easy, and the building has great amenities. The elevator wait wasnâ€™t bad at all, never more than five minutes. Overall, a solid stay with good vibes and practical comforts.

Clean cozy modern studio within a big apartment building. Great host (responsive, local recommendations). Walkable to shops and restaurants. Guards are present at the front entrance providing extra security for guests and residents. Good stay for me.

The apartment itself is very nice and the check in process was very easy. The Netflix on the TV was much appreciated also.
Unfortunately the room did have a strong durian smell which was off-putting and the lifts took quite a long time so bear in mind if you book a taxi. The beach nearby was shut which we did not know so visited the rooftop pool but there was no beds to lounge apart from in the pool itself and half of the lounge area was closed which was disappointing.

First time in Vung Tau and really enjoyed this seaside town. The condo was perfect with an incredible view, better than average shower, and lots of space. Enjoyed the Netflix and deck equally. The large space was great to have with 2 people sharing it, making it comfortable.
The location was excellent for the beach, convenience store, restaurants, scooter rental and general walking around.
The gym and pool were super to have right in the building, making the stay nice and the place to come back if ever in the area.

she's a wonderful host and the apartment is amazing.
