1. We booked this place for a longer stay of 20 days, and after the first night we decided to leave because of the uncleanliness. There was lots of mold in the bathroom and the kitchen vent, and it also smelled horrible. 2. This place is filled to the brim with children and is simply overcrowded. The pool was chaotic and loud, and the wait for the elevator was unnecessarily long. Also the people arenâ€™t the nicest.
Iâ€™m not one to write bad reviews, but I felt that the advertisement for this place is misleading.

It was a very pleasant stay at Hoa's place. The apartment was very clean with beautiful view from the balcony . Hoa was a great host. She responded quickly to my questions. Thank you again Hoa.

I had a wonderful stay. the host is very nice and responsive. The place has good view of the partial oceans' view. for the price that I pay, that was a good view. If you want to have by full view of the emotions, you have to pay additional fifty percent more. Also, the 2nd room is not sealed, it has an opening so that you can share the air conditioning from the master bedroom.  so if you talk the other person in that room can hear you. Had a lovely few days and this Airbnb is perfect for exploring the area. Good facilities in the building (although the pool is closed on a Tuesday) and has everything we could want. A great stay and would recommend

A very comfortable apartment a few minutes walk to the beach. Very comfortable beds and furniture. There is a very large supermarket and department store 5 minutes walk up the street and a huge beach 5 minutes walk down the street. The area has many restaurants, both large or small local places.
The shower was hot with excellent pressure, wifi was good, kitchen was well stocked and even had some food and spices. The host responded very quickly to questions.
I would definitely return.

Hoa was a fantastically responsive host - very quick and helpful on messages and met us for check in. The flat decor and view was a little different to pictures which confused us, though the flat was comfortable for our short stay. The amenities in the complex were good - pool clean and quiet enough and lots of communal spaces within the blocks. Overall cleanliness levels of the flat were okay but could be improved- we found several small cockroaches, which the host says they will address before the next guests. Bathroom drains occasionally quite smelly, though this appeared to be a wider issue than just this flat.

The complex also boasts kidâ€™sâ€™ lazy river on the 5th floor as well as a rooftop pool. If you are from the west you need to know that bathing suits are monitored. My friend is 66 years old and wore a bathing suit that looks like a tank top
and skirt. She was not allowed to get in the pool. This is one of those cultural differencesâ€¦which adds merriment to travel.
This condo has a nice balcony overlooking the largest round about in Vietnam and the 6th largest in the world.
IFurthermore it is in walking distance to the Lotte shopping center. You can also see the Christ statue and Buddha as well as a beautiful city and Mountain View â€¦ especially at sunset.
After 6 weeks in Vietnam this is BY FAR the cleanest place Iâ€™ve stayed.

Rooms don't have windows, which can be a turn off for some, but I'm perfectly fine with it since there's no dead air smell and bath room has sufficient air ventilation. Walls are a bit thin though, so be mindful, it's not so thin that you have to whisper everytime you speak, but better not be too loud, normal volume is almost inaudible. Bathroom is a bit small, but is clean, doesnt smell, both hotncold water available, ventilation system can dry your clothes if you're desperate :/
Other than that, shared space is great, there's parking space, water, a kitchen, a big desk, plenty of plants and good air. If you ever have a party big enough, just book the entire place, that'd be such a cool hangout spot
Location is good imo, not too far from the beach, near the center of the city, and is VERY close to a SUPER popular bakery spot!

This is the nicest airbnb that weâ€™ve stayed in  the whole of our time in Vietnam ! Itâ€™s a lot bigger than it seems in the pictures and the view is truly spectacular (we didnâ€™t want to leave). Not very far to the beach - maybe 5 mins walking - and there are plenty of littler shops selling everything you need. Wow! Vung Tau is beautiful. Trangs place sits just off the shore line. You can see the water and mountains from her private balcony. Trang was very helpful for this American who had never been to Vietnam. She was responsive and always eager to help when I had questions. I recommend that anyone coming to Vung tau give her place a try, youâ€™ll be happy you did.
Good place to stay. I recommend it
Thank you for letting us stay we really enjoyed our stay

Trang was one of the best hosts I've had on Airbnb, and I didn't even meet her. She was extremely responsive, kind, and made all efforts to make sure my stay was comfortable, along with helping with local requests. The homestay was beautiful, with a nice balcony and view. The bed is comfy, the bathroom is clean and the kitchen was as functional as possible. Check-in was super easy, and it took me no time to get comfortable and let my bags down. Trang is a 10/10 host. The place I would rate an 8.5/10. The main issue I had was the noise from the construction, karaoke, and bars across the street, but this is Vietnam! It's a lively country. I got used to it, and I'm someone who has mild misophonia. There aren't any walkable convenience store locations, but it's about a 5-min grab bike to a nearby one that'll cost you 42.000 VND there and back. It's worth the ride to see the beautiful coast views on your commute. I could say much more, but this place is easily recommendable. Good vibes!
Amazing views from the balcony. Great to have a washing machine. Well equipped kitchen. Spotlessly clean. Had everything we needed for a great stay.
great value and beautiful view.
I would live here full timeâ€¦ surely that says enough :)
Very nice place to stay with a beautiful view. It is a very peaceful place and very quiet part of the town.

A great location in Vung Tau. During the week Vung Tau is a calm city without traffic jams and many local people swimming in the sea at dawn and sunset. During the weekend the buzz of people from Saigon is noticeable. Trang's place is in a calm neighbourhood with a lovely sea and mountain view. There is occasional karaoke from a nearby villa but everything is quiet after 10pm.
It was my 3rd time in the building and I enjoy the area a lot. Walkable good coffee from Simon's, multiple good and affordable seafood places. Vung Tau city is just a short ride away with plenty of options in entertainment and food.
Trangs place is convenient with good internet and the essential amenities. The building looks a bit older but is very convenient and quiet.
This is it. It has everything you need, foods, places to go, walking on the beach, grab is cheap
Amazing place!
Reply nice, peaceful spot with a great view. Really enjoyed our few days here.

Stayed for 1 month
Pleasant stay. Clean, comfortable. Good location. Strong aircon, hot water. Solid wifi. Responsive host.
The only negatives were
1) elevator waiting times (place is super popular for people on vacation)
2) some noise late at night from people partying outside
Overall, I enjoyed my trip and would book again.

Linhs place is one of the nicer apartments in this building which is made up of privately owned units mostly occupied by large local families. It is 36 floors with 4 lifts 2 of which only go to the 16th floor, we waited almost 10 minutes for a lift from the 17th floor to ground level one day and regularly had to wait 5 minutes lifts were often full to bursting with one or 2 families often noisy and with very little consideration for private space. The infinity pool on the 36th floor has around 4 proper sun beds (one broken) one doesnâ€™t adjust and 4 wicker beds not suitable for sunbathing on therefore it is almost impossible to bag a bed as the pool is usually full of very loud local families who seem to be oblivious of any around them. 8 beds for 36 floors ! Unbelievable. The gym is stocked with cheap non commercial bikes and treadmills most of which donâ€™t work or are defective in some way. The beach is a 5 mile building site which is being completely rebuilt. There is constant noise

Fancy, cozy place. Extra small bedroom was very nice, where you could hide and relax. Apartment is in a shade and you don't get too much sun, while having amazing view over the airport's runway. Apartment is on 17th floor. We had very good sleep here every night. Very large balcony. Elevator waiting time is the biggest weakness - building itself is huge and during holidays you have to wait a bit extra. But you get nice coworking area, nice swimming pool and even gym (a bit crowdy and small, but you still have it, in case you don't want to go anywhere else). Shopping centre Lotte is near. Beach is near. Internet is "ok". - anyway - we had amazing stay for 1 month.

Alles im Ganzen war es ein super Apartment. Ausstattung und die zugehÃ¶rigen Leistungen. Das einzige schlechte und schlimme Erfahrung war ğŸ‘Œder Aufzug. Man braucht ca. 10 Minuten bist man unten oder oben zu seinem Zimmer kommt.

Sophia is a lovely host in person and was always responsive on chat. The apartment is very comfortable with an excellent view. I would have liked a top sheet on the bed with a duvet/doona, rather than just a synthetic blanket. Other than that, it was a great stay.

Sofia is an incredibly friendly, kind and generous host. She was very understanding and flexible when my arrival time drastically changed, Gave me a tour of Vung Tau so I was more comfortable with understanding the area, and was very responsive to messages. Giving me local advice when I needed it, including a very convenient limousine bus service between Ho Chi Minh City and Vung Tau, which drops you off and picks you up from the apartment building directly. Vung Tau is a very nice place to relax at, with lots to do, There's some nice restaurants and coffee shops nearby the apartment, and the rest of the peninsula is a very short Moped / Taxi ride away (which is very affordable in Vietnam). I came here for 3 weeks to focus on some important work I had to do, And the apartment was the perfect place to do it, with the rooftop pool and local amenities to relax at when I needed a break.
Sehr schÃ¶ne, sehr saubere Wohnung (wie abgebildet), toller Ausblick und Supermarkt gleich nebenan. Frau Sofia war fÃ¼r 3 Monate eine ausgezeichnet Gastgeberin.

Sofia er ikke bare en vert, hun er den beste Verten! Hun gjÃ¸r alt for at du fÃ¥r det fint! Bruk henne, hun er verdt hver krone! Jeg vil komme tilbake igjen og igjen!

She lives a few floors lower in the same building, so she is always handy in case of need.  She is a perfect host, and this is a fine apartment for a long-term stay.   Thank you, Sofia.

Very nice view, very well cleaned apartment taken care by a careful host. Especially if you stay for a rather long time, the kitchen is good for cooking with sufficient utensils. Highly recommend!
Easy to go to places nearby but better by motorbike or car as the walk seems a bit challenging in too hot weather.

Wonderful, beautiful stay, the host Chau was simply outstanding making everything easy and feel comfortable to be at home.
The view is gorgeous and the apartment spotless with much to explore across town.

Great location with a large department store across the street. The apartment itself is cute and perfect for me as a solo traveler. The host is very communicative and flexible. Generally all good,but..
the place was awesome for money and quality. surely not much to do around especially if you want to go for nightlife. Vung Tao offers practically nothing. It's ok if you are a digital nomad
Sea is not very nice and the pool of the building is kinda annoying because of too many controls and security watching you as you are some sort of criminal. the gym can be annoying for the same thing. the apartment it's great. it's small. and unfortunately has a room completely useless if you are 1 or 2. the place can host 4-6 ppl but would be super uncomfortable more than 2.
Chau it's very helpful and give stuff you need as for example the bed was impossible to sleep on but I ask to add a toppers and she did. the only bad feeling with her is made by odd pricings. when I asked extension she gave me disproportionately price. that I didn't like. maybe English was the problem but I asked an extension and it was more expensive than booking new dates

Not much more I could add as others have stated, Chau is an exceptional host. Itâ€™s the little things she captures that most oversee and this makes the stay that much more pleasant.
Even having usb outlets in the electric sockets for charging, providing slippers to use for the pool or just walking around nearby. Kitchen was well equipped for making or having meals.
Very well designed and modernized.
Views are also amazing from the unit to the amazing infinity pool and gym at the 36th rooftop floor.
Highly recommend.

This is my 2nd time staying at one of Chau's apartments at The Song.
Chau is a pleasure to deal with and her apartments are always clean & tidy and well laid out. There's shops and restaurants downstairs and back beach is walking distance. Will come back again next time I'm in town.

This was a short stay but I wished I stayed longer! Great value, perfect location, and the room is just perfect. Chau was also very friendly and flexible with check-in, everything was smooth and easy. Thank you!

overall, this is a great place as it stands, especially for a longer period and if you want to get a sense of "normal life" in Vung Tau. Having said that, I do have to note that if you are looking for bars and such, I didn't find much to do at night in the area, unlike the front beach area. The area quiets down at 10pm, which, for someone who likes to walk around everywhere, it can become a little boring.
Despite that, you can find what you need in your daily life close by. A big super market, a lot of restaurants and the apartment building itself hosts various cafÃ©s a convenience store and restaurants.
one more thing to add, and this is more a personal preference, the mattress was a little too firm for my liking and the sofa is functional but I couldn't find a comfortable position to sit on it for long periods of time. again, this is personal preference and definitely not reflective of my overall satisfaction of the apartment which was amazing.
I would definitely stay here again.
Great place to stay

The host is highly responsive and courteous. The room is tidy, well-lit, and offers stunning scenery at an affordable rate, that you can enjoy beautiful sunsets from its balcony.
The only drawback is that the soundproofing is lacking, making it possible to hear loud conversations from neighboring rooms.
what a great place! calm comfortable clean!

Great room, very clean and comfortable with a stunning view. No complaints there. However, it must be noted that the building is absurdly crowded on the weekends and the elevator situation is comically bad. Be prepared to wait 30+ minutes for the elevator if you'd like to go down during a crowded time (especially around dinner), or walk 26 floors down the stairs like we did. If you can manage that, I highly recommend this room.

Pros: view from above and location, host is very responsive and prompt. However, I did not understand where to meet to pick up keys. Cons: only one room key for my party of two. Very crowded building, elevators are very busy and it takes a long time most of the day (average ~10 minutes, longest 25 mins before we took stairs from the 27th floor). The room had a strong naphthalene (moth ball) smell to hide what appeared to be a vomit smell. My girlfriend mopped the living room and the smell improved somewhat. The bed linen had hair all over, we requested fresh ones and they promptly changed them. The bed blanket was also used/dirty (we changed it out). Other very basic things are lacking: there is no lamp by the bed or switch for low lights (have to get up to turn off lights, all bright or pitch black). Only two (2!) towels (bath) provided TOTAL, no bathroom mats, no hand towels, kitchen towels, etc. Walls are paper thin - get ready to hear neighbors partying loudly late at night.

Harmonia sent us clear instructions with photos which made it very easy to check in and out. It was a lovely 1 bedroom apartment - clean and sunny and with a balcony, washing machine and kitchen. We were trying to receive a package from another city and Harmonia contacted the shop and arranged for delivery. Thank you for all of your help! We felt right at home.

I have to write a review about this stay because it was simply the best! The host first of all gave me very clear instructions about entering. She was so helpful with everything, and there's a cleaner hired to work around you which is perfect as I did spend alot of time inside the apartment as i stayed here for online study . The host also always messaged me saying 'just let me know if you need anything', she was so nice and i will be staying here again! I stayed here for 3 weeks, the pool and gym is perfect, the views are nice to distract yourself whilst your working out haha! The aircon is perfect, the bed is super comfy and the wardrobe is huge!, the tv has netflix and youtube and i enjoyed my little time outs on the sofa. The balcony has a washing line so you can hang literally every bit of washing you have. The bathroom is lovely and has plenty of storage for all your toiletries. I love the balcony and I just loved everything lol! Thanks so much, I shall be back!

Great value for money in an excellent location. I travelled alone so the two double beds were not necessary for me but would be perfect for a family wishing to travel to Vung Tau. It's a very big room. Of course, it is spacious enough for one person, and I recommend it for couples and families. There are many delicious restaurants in the surrounding area. It's a little far from the coast, but it's possible to walk there.

Room decoration (full of plants) really worths the spend, plus the place is very easy to find. Host is very nice and very supportive. This is definitely a great choice to revisit if I come back Vung Tau, and hopefully bring some friends to enjoy this remarkably comfortable natural stay.
Nice and comfortable big room with alots of plants! Easy to find. Good place to stay for long time. Nice shops and restaurants near house. I booked late minute both are very helpful.

Biens place is awesome. A much better value than a hotel in the area. He owns two restaurants and I walked to one of them and it was also great. If I ever have friends visiting Vung Tau I will recommend them to stay with Bien.

I love the space so much, it was peaceful to stay in and have a good ambiance. The host is also very friendly, helpful, and responsive. Would recommend. Nice place to stay with friends and not very far to explore Vung Tau. Love.
